summary: In React, we don't update the DOM directly, we tell React what we want the DOM to look like, and React tackles the rest.  But how exactly does it do this.  In this tutorial, we'll unpack exactly when and why React re-renders, and how we can use this information to optimize the performance of our React apps
title: Why React Re-Renders

summary: An in-depth look at the technical stack behind this very blog.  We'll see how I use Next's API routes to implement my hit and like counters, how I use MDX to add interaction and customization, and how I organize my codebase, among others
title: How I Built My Blog

summary: Happy Pride month.  In this tutorial, I'll share a handful of my favourite animation tricks.  You'll learn how to build an animated wavy pride flag using CSS keyframes and linear gradients...

summary: An in-depth tutorial that teaches how to create one of the most adorable interactions I've ever created.  We'll learn how to use React components and hooks to abstract behaviours, and see how to design the perfect API.  Even if you're not into animations, I think you'll find it interesting
title: Boop!

summary: Next allows you to do server-side data-fetching, but what happens when that data needs to change on the client.  This brief tutorial shows how to re-fetch the props without doing a full server reload
title: Refreshing Server-Side Props

summary: In our community, it's so common for developer projects to be open-source.  I'm breaking with this trend for my blog, but I have good reasons.  In this article, I'll share my reasoning, as well as a workaround in case you _really_ want to see the source...
title: Why My Blog is Closed-Source

summary: As remote work becomes increasingly popular, I am frequently asked how to get started.  This article shares everything I know about landing that first remote gig
title: Finding your first remote job

summary: CSS variables are *really* cool, and they're incredibly powerful when it comes to React.  This tutorial shows how we can use them with React to create dynamic themes. title: CSS Variables for React Devs
